divs: sighting detailson the evening of around june 5th, 1998 i was standing outside a music venue called "skrappy's" in tuscon az. i am still hazy on the date, but recall a well known band named rocket from the crypt was playing across town that night, so searching their tour records might shed some light on the exact date of the sighting. at approximately 7:30pm az. time, i was staring up at the beautiful night sky outside the venue before the show. my body was facing west as i could see the last traces of light from the sunset that day. out of the east, at an alarming right of speed appeared a round ball of light a little brighter than your avg. star heading west. i could tell by my field of vision that it was at least 13,000 ft high and was not a bug flying a few feet over of me. it looked very out of place in the night sky due to its immense speed and trajectory, and thats what made me take notice. it made an "s" like maneuver as it headed in a westerly direction until it was directly overhead at which time it stopped on a dime with almost no deceleration and made two perfect concentric circles about the size of a penny in a counter clock-wise motion. then it instantly shot out in a curve like path all the way to the western part of the sky disappearing over the horizon into the sunset. the complete length of time it took the object to traverse the whole scope and view of the sky from horizon east to horizon west was around 3-4 seconds. one can only speculate what that rate of speed is. there were a few other people standing outside around the area at the time, but due to the rate of speed of the sighting\craft, it was apparently only witnessed by me that night. i know that the object was not a shooting star or meteor, as they do not move like that. as well, this object had no debris trail. it was not any helicopter or aircraft that i am aware of. that kind of acceleration\deceleration would kill any living being on board using our current human technology. i did not see the object for the rest of the night. i feel it was not of earthly origin and was benevolent.
trends: There have been 173 other sightings in Tucson
There were no other sightings in Tucson on or around June 5th 1998
